Data Dictionary - Plays

Source: vignettes/dictionary_plays.Rmd
dictionary_plays.Rmd
knitr::kable(cbbreadr::dictionary_plays)
field data_type description
play_id integer An identifier unique to each game that corresponds to a specific play in the game.
on_floor_id_1 integer The athlete_id of a player on the floor. The order of the on_the_floor columns is arbitrary.
on_floor_id_2 integer The athlete_id of a player on the floor. The order of the on_the_floor columns is arbitrary.
on_floor_id_3 integer The athlete_id of a player on the floor. The order of the on_the_floor columns is arbitrary.
on_floor_id_4 integer The athlete_id of a player on the floor. The order of the on_the_floor columns is arbitrary.
on_floor_id_5 integer The athlete_id of a player on the floor. The order of the on_the_floor columns is arbitrary.
on_floor_id_6 integer The athlete_id of a player on the floor. The order of the on_the_floor columns is arbitrary.
on_floor_id_7 integer The athlete_id of a player on the floor. The order of the on_the_floor columns is arbitrary.
on_floor_id_8 integer The athlete_id of a player on the floor. The order of the on_the_floor columns is arbitrary.
on_floor_id_9 integer The athlete_id of a player on the floor. The order of the on_the_floor columns is arbitrary.
on_floor_id_10 integer The athlete_id of a player on the floor. The order of the on_the_floor columns is arbitrary.
on_floor_id_11 integer The athlete_id of a player on the floor. The order of the on_the_floor columns is arbitrary. This column is typically NA–when it is filled in, it indicates that substitutions for the game may have been recorded incorrectly, as it suggests that there are more players on the floor than allowed.
on_floor_id_12 integer The athlete_id of a player on the floor. The order of the on_the_floor columns is arbitrary. This column is typically NA–when it is filled in, it indicates that substitutions for the game may have been recorded incorrectly, as it suggests that there are more players on the floor than allowed.
on_floor_id_13 integer The athlete_id of a player on the floor. The order of the on_the_floor columns is arbitrary. This column is typically NA–when it is filled in, it indicates that substitutions for the game may have been recorded incorrectly, as it suggests that there are more players on the floor than allowed.
on_floor_id_14 integer The athlete_id of a player on the floor. The order of the on_the_floor columns is arbitrary. This column is typically NA–when it is filled in, it indicates that substitutions for the game may have been recorded incorrectly, as it suggests that there are more players on the floor than allowed.
on_floor_name_1 character The name of the player on the floor identified by on_floor_id_1.
on_floor_name_2 character The name of the player on the floor identified by on_floor_id_2.
on_floor_name_3 character The name of the player on the floor identified by on_floor_id_3.
on_floor_name_4 character The name of the player on the floor identified by on_floor_id_4.
on_floor_name_5 character The name of the player on the floor identified by on_floor_id_5.
on_floor_name_6 character The name of the player on the floor identified by on_floor_id_6.
on_floor_name_7 character The name of the player on the floor identified by on_floor_id_7.
on_floor_name_8 character The name of the player on the floor identified by on_floor_id_8.
on_floor_name_9 character The name of the player on the floor identified by on_floor_id_9.
on_floor_name_10 character The name of the player on the floor identified by on_floor_id_10.
on_floor_name_11 character The name of the player on the floor identified by on_floor_id_11.
on_floor_name_12 character The name of the player on the floor identified by on_floor_id_12.
on_floor_name_13 character The name of the player on the floor identified by on_floor_id_13.
on_floor_name_14 character The name of the player on the floor identified by on_floor_id_14.
on_floor_team_1 character The team of the player on the floor identified by on_floor_id_1.
on_floor_team_2 character The team of the player on the floor identified by on_floor_id_2.
on_floor_team_3 character The team of the player on the floor identified by on_floor_id_3.
on_floor_team_4 character The team of the player on the floor identified by on_floor_id_4.
on_floor_team_5 character The team of the player on the floor identified by on_floor_id_5.
on_floor_team_6 character The team of the player on the floor identified by on_floor_id_6.
on_floor_team_7 character The team of the player on the floor identified by on_floor_id_7.
on_floor_team_8 character The team of the player on the floor identified by on_floor_id_8.
on_floor_team_9 character The team of the player on the floor identified by on_floor_id_9.
on_floor_team_10 character The team of the player on the floor identified by on_floor_id_10.
on_floor_team_11 character The team of the player on the floor identified by on_floor_id_11.
on_floor_team_12 character The team of the player on the floor identified by on_floor_id_12.
on_floor_team_13 character The team of the player on the floor identified by on_floor_id_13.
on_floor_team_14 character The team of the player on the floor identified by on_floor_id_14.
shot_info_shooter_id integer For plays where a shot occurred, the athlete_id of the player taking the shot.
shot_info_shooter_name character For plays where a shot occurred, the name of the player taking the shot.
shot_info_made logical A boolean indicating whether the player made the shot or not.
shot_info_range character A string identifying the range from which the shot was taken: ““free_throw”“,”“jumper”“,”“rim”“, or”“three_pointer”“.
shot_info_assisted logical A boolean indicating whether another player was credited with an assist on the play.
shot_info_assisted_by_id integer If an assist occurred on the play, the athlete_id of the player credited with an assist.
shot_info_assisted_by_name character If an assist occurred on the play, the name of the player credited with an assist.
shot_info_location_x numeric If available, the x_coordinate of the location of the shot, as seen from overhead.
shot_info_location_y integer If available, the y_coordinate of the location of the shot, as seen from overhead.
participants_id_1 integer The athlete_id of the primary participant in the play.
participants_id_2 integer The athlete_id of the secondary participant in the play.
participants_name_1 character The name of the primary participant in the play.
participants_name_2 character The name of the secondary participant in the play.
game_id integer A unique identifier for each game.
game_source_id character The unique identifier for each game from the data source CBBD scrapes from.
game_start_date character The start date and time, given in ISO 8601 format in the GMT time zone.
season integer An integer corresponding to a season of college basketball. CBBD’s convention is to use the year in which the championship takes place, so if a game took place in the fall of 2024, the season would be recorded as ““2025”“.
season_type character A string identifying whether the tracked game is a ““regular”” season game or a ““postseason”” game.
game_type character A string indicating whether the game took place as a normal, regular season game (““STD”“), or whether the game took place as a part of a tournament (”“TRNMNT”“). Tournament games include both regular season and postseason tournaments. For earlier years, this column will sometimes represent the round of the March Madness tournament that a game took place in (”“RD64”“,”“RD32”“,”“RD16”“,”“QTR”“,”“SEMI”“,”“FINAL”“).
tournament character If the game takes place as a part of a tournament, this identifies the tournament.
id integer A unique identifier for each play.
source_id character The unique identifier for each play from the data source CBBD scrapes from.
play_type character The type of action that occurs on the play.
is_home_team logical A boolean indicating if the primary participant in the play was playng at home.
team_id integer The team_id of the primary participant in the play.
team character The team of the primary participant in the play
conference character The conference of the primary participant in the play.
team_seed integer If reported, the seed of the team of the primary participant in the tournament that the game takes in.
opponent_id integer A unique identifier for the player’s opponent team.
opponent character The name of the player’s opponent team.
opponent_conference character The name of the conference of the player’s opponent team.
opponent_seed integer If reported, the seed of the player’s opponent team in the tournament that the game takes in.
home_score integer The number of points the home team has following the play.
away_score integer The number of points the away team has following the play.
home_win_probability numeric Based on the pregame spread, amount of time remaining in the game, which team has possession, and the current point differential in the game, the modeled probability that the home team wins the game immediately following the play.
period integer The period that the play takes place in.
clock character The time showing on the game clock when the play occurs.
seconds_remaining integer The total number of seconds remaining in the period when the play takes place.
scoring_play logical A boolean indicating whether or not points were scored on the play.
shooting_play logical A boolean indicating whether or not the play was a shooting play.
score_value integer The number of points scored on the play.
wallclock character The timestamp for when the play ocurred, given in ISO 8601 format in the GMT time zone.
play_text character Text indicating what happened on the play.

Developed by John Edwards.

Site built with pkgdown 2.1.3.
